definition: proposition/argument
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Always ground your opinion on fact.
sentences.chinese: 要永遠根據事實而立論。

sentences.english: Along with horary of push forward, he is more and more stubborn to own argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的推進，他對自己的立論越來越固執。

sentences.english: The scientific theory should be the theory of unification theory.
sentences.chinese: 刑罰正當根據學說之科學立論是統一論。

sentences.english: I think Joba's injury concerns are well-founded.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲張伯倫會受傷是有其立論基礎的。

sentences.english: The trouble is that the entire theory may be dead wrong.
sentences.chinese: 問題是整個立論可能是全盤錯誤。
這是一本立論膚淺的書。

sentences.english: The criteria for its literary criticism are respectively based on two perspectives: collection of historical materials and compilation of historical biographies.
sentences.chinese: 其立論標準，分別基於史料採集與史傳編著兩個視角。

sentences.english: Therefore the Chinese medicine treats diabetes often by "the three urinary deficiencies" the argument.
sentences.chinese: 所以中醫治療消渴病常以“三消”立論。

definition: to consider (a matter)/to deliberate
complete and accurate
concise/the details in brief
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to make a catalogue/catalogue/list
to infer/to judge/inference/judgment/conclusion
to comment on/commentary
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to comment/a point by point commentary
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
to translate (to another language)/to convert
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
